om.equation
Class Equation

java.lang.Object
  om.equation.Line
      om.equation.Equation

public class Equation
extends Line

Includes static utility methods to convert equations. Also represents the outer <int_equation> tag in each equation.

fEndSlope

protected float fEndSlope
Italic slope of end character (e.g. if the character has width 100, height 10, and italic slope 0.5 then it is considered to extend to 100,0 but only to 95,10 (the bottom edge ends (italic slope) * (height) pixels left)

create

public static Equation create(java.lang.String sEquation,
                              float fZoom)
                       throws EquationFormatException
Creates an equation from text (LaTeX-like) format, using the default ItemFactory that includes all standard equation items.

Parameters:
sEquation - Equation text
fZoom - Zoom factor (1.0 = default)
Returns:
Equation object
Throws:
EquationFormatException - If there's anything wrong with the input

convertTextSize

public int convertTextSize(int iTextSize)
Converts a constant to an actual pixel size. (Note that if equations are being scaled for accessibility, the graphics context will be scaled when drawn, so we don't need to use different sizes here.)

Parameters:
iTextSize - TEXTSIZE_xxx constant
Returns:
Actual size in pixels

decreaseTextSize

public static int decreaseTextSize(int iTextSize)
Obtains a smaller text size, but only if we haven't run out of the range.

Parameters:
iTextSize - Current size
Returns:
One size smaller (or same if smallest)

Returns:
A suitable gap for use as spacing of some sort
